snippet: The Yankees have invested $175 million in Masahiro Tanaka, who will be out at least six weeks with a small tear in his elbow. The team has now lost four starting pitchers.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that New York Yankees pitcher Masahiro Tanaka was the only player keeping this season from sinking, and now he has a partial tear in his elbow; holds that after investing $175 million, really important question for Yankees is whether Tanaka can pitch in 2016.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees have invested $175 million in Masahiro Tanaka, who will be out at least six weeks with a small tear in his elbow. The team has now lost four starting pitchers.

headline.seo: Masahiro Tanaka's Injury Raises Questions for Yankees
headline.main: Yankees’ Future Hinges on a Troubled Elbow
headline.print_headline: Yanks’ Future Hinges on a Troubled Elbow
